info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 2:30PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO BRIEFLY HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON... A band of moderate to briefly heavy snow will move into Orange County between 245 PM and 315 PM. Visibilities may be quickly reduced to 1/2 mile or less at times as gusty northwest winds continue. An additional 1 to 2 inches of snowfall is possible before the snow tapers off and ends late this afternoon into early this evening. A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect until 700 PM EST. Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph are likely this afternoon into tonight, and a Wind Advisory remains in effect until 400 AM EDT. Temperatures in the upper 20s continue to fall, and will be around 20 degrees by early this evening, and reach lows around 15 overnight. Gusty northwest wind will produce wind chill values in the single digits through this evening, and as low as zero to 5 below zero at times overnight. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Also, untreated surfaces may become slippery this afternoon and this evening as temperatures continue to fall.
